page.title: 08Village Facilities
page.content: Whn we inteviewed twenty six people who lived in Rowney green, we asked them: Are there any facilities you would like which you haven't got in your village? The answers varied slighly. A few people said they would like an off license and a church. A young mother said she would like to build a primary school for her children. A public telephone box was asked for because a few people in Rowney Green do not have telephones in their houses. But the majority of the population in Rowney Green wanted a small village shop because the post office in the village has bee closed down and also Rowney Green is an isolated village and if there was a shop in village the people wouldn't have to ravel so far to buy grocerries.
